abstract: The bidder for the biotechnology company ImClone said a drug maker that proposed a $6.1 billion takeover would make a formal bid or withdraw by the end of day Wednesday.
snippet: The bidder for the biotechnology company ImClone said a drug maker that proposed a $6.1 billion takeover would make a formal bid or withdraw by the end of day Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: ImClone Systems, the biotechnology company controlled by Carl C. Icahn, said a drug maker that proposed a $6.1 billion takeover would make a formal bid or withdraw by the end of the day on Wednesday.

headline.main: Bidder for ImClone Nearing a Decision, Icahn Says
headline.print_headline: ImClone’s Unidentified Bidder to Decide Soon, Icahn Says
